data.title: Tutorial
data.html: This is the world in 2021. Feel free to explore: drag the globe around, zoom in and out by scrolling in/out (or touchpad gestures). When you're ready to start our time-travel journey, press the button in the lower right. Also, this site is a little computationally-intensive, so if the site ever freezes, simply refresh and it should work fine. I guarantee that this map will have some errors in naming or borders, I've made a cursory effort to clean it up, but keep in mind that this may not be 100% accurate, especially in Asia and Africa.

data.title: Overview
data.html: Welcome to the year 1000! At this point, there are roughly 300 million people on the planet, and empires are popping up left and right! Let's see what's going on in each region of the world!

data.title: Europe
data.html: Here in Europe, things are a little crazy (as they are in basically every point in history). The Byzantine Empire is the major player in the region, Feudalism is in full swing, and northern Europe is still reeling from Viking raids. Watch out for the Christian schism and the Crusades coming up! Meanwhile, the Umayyads provided a Muslim presence in Spain, which was called al-Andalus.

data.title: Middle East
data.html: Speaking of Islam, Muslims took hold of the Middle East, and Shia-Sunni conflicts had been raging for a few hundred years at this point. This map shows the region as split into many different caliphates, but the Abbasids take complete control over the region not long after 1000.

data.title: Asia
data.html:
Moving on to Asia, where the Song dynasty is in power. China saw a very successful period under the Song, with printing processes allowing literature to spread and a stable government promoting peace. The Song ruled with neo-Confucianism and held civil service in high regard. In Japan, Buddhism and Shintoism supplanted themselves as the primary religions. In India and Southeast Asia, Hinduism was the primary religion, with Buddhist influence, and trade was the primary economic focus of these states.

ALSO... THE MONGOLS ARE COMING!!

data.title: Africa
data.html: In Africa, Islam spread from the Mediterranean and the trans-Saharan trade routes, as well as through the Indian Ocean trade routes in Swahili Coast, but local tribal faiths remained somewhat intact for much of the continent, and fledgling empires such as Mali began to appear.

data.title: America
data.html: On the other side of the world, in the Americas, Native American groups are all over North America, and the beginnings of Mesoamerican empires are taking shape.

data.title: Overview
data.html: Now, we're at the year 1279! Let's take a look around.

data.title: Europe
data.html: Feudalism still exists here in Europe, but nation-states are growing in power. The Magna Carta was signed in England, and the Spanish drove out the Muslims (although the worst is still yet to come...). The Byzantine Empire is still strong, although those Turks seem to be a little intimidating...

data.title: Asia
data.html: And here it is: the Mongols. They took everything.. From horse-riding nomads to rulers of Asia and the Middle East... that Genghis Khan dude was crazy (successful)! The Chagatai, Golden Horde, Ilkhanate, and the Yuan Dynasty in China were all Mongol controlled-areas. Just mindblowing stuff... Still, they brought a lot of trade across their empire, even though a lot more was being exchanged than just goods (*cough, cough* The Black Death)!

data.title: Middle East
data.html: After the Abbasid Empire had its Pax Islamica, the Abbasids finally fell last year and those pesky Mongols took control of the Middle East! All this in the middle of the Crusades and other intra-Muslim conflicts! The nerve!

data.title: Africa
data.html: In Africa, Islam continued to spread from the Mediterranean and the trans-Saharan trade routes, as well as through the Indian Ocean trade routes in Swahili Coast. Mali continued to grow in strength as well, and apparently this guy named Mansa Musa is betting big on the gold trade there, hope it works out for him!

data.title: America
data.html: Again, the fledgling empires in Central America and the Andes are continuing to grow, as they are slowly coming up on the peak of their civilizations. The Mayans establish themselves in the Yucatan.

data.title: Overview
data.html: In 1492, Columbus sailed the ocean blue is what we were taught as kids, but there was a lot more going on in the world at this time too, let's check it out.

data.title: Europe
data.html: In this period, nation-states have become even stronger. Not much has changed in Western Europe, although the Spanish had an inquisition that seemed pretty intense. the Hundred Years' War just wrapped up, but I doubt England and France will stop fighting anytime soon. Eastern Europe is much more interesting at this point, with the Russians establishing themselves in Moscow, and wait... what happened to the Byzantine Empire?

data.title: Middle East
data.html: Yep, just what I expected. It was those Turks I was telling you about earlier! The Ottoman Turks took over Constantinople and made it the capital of the Ottoman Empire. The Turks have also gained power throughout the rest of the Middle East as well.

data.title: Asia
data.html: Finally, the Chinese were able to re-establish Chinese rule of China with the Ming dynasty! The Ming strengthened the tribute system to enforce their influence over SE Asia. Interestingly, Japan is in an era of feudalism that was eerily similar to what was happening in Europe just now. Meanwhile, in India, political power is still somewhat decentralized, but Muslims are gaining power in the North, while Hindu trade-based societies still have control of the South.

data.title: Africa
data.html: In Africa, the Songhai grew in power, challenging the Mali over trans-Saharan trade dominance and growing wealthy themselves. Oh, and that Mansa Musa guy? He ended up being one of the richest men in history! Meanwhile, the Eastern African trade states are still raking in profits from the Indian Ocean trade, especially as their technology gets better.

data.title: America
data.html: The height of Mesoamerica, right before the Europeans show up. Everything is fabulous: the Maya, Aztec, and Inca are all thriving, managing large empires and sustaining advanced civilizations. I mean, Machu Picchu is amazing, and the Aztecs and Mayans built several large pyramids themselves as well. Real geniuses, they were, even though the Aztecs were a little brutal with their flower wars and humans sacrifices... a small price to pay for advanced calendars, I guess.

data.title: Overview
data.html: Welcome to 1650! A lot has changed in the 150 years or so we skipped over, so let's hop right in!

data.title: Europe
data.html: The pattern of nation-states growing stronger continued into this period, and the Ottoman Empire's expansion begins to threaten the rest of Europe. However, Europe's biggest influence on this period is what happened throughout the rest of the world...

data.title: Middle East
data.html: Like I just mentioned, the Ottomans are growing to take over much of the Middle East, while the Safavid and Mughal Empires (the three collectively known as the Gunpowder Empires) are all jostling for control in the region.

data.title: Asia
data.html: Just as the Chinese regained native control of China, the Manchus (from Manchuria, known for their hair) institute the Qing Dynasty. Meanwhile, the remnants of the Mongol Empire are still present in Central Asia, while the Mughal Empire (Muslims) are in control of much of India. Look for political and religious tensions to allow the British to leech some power in the region! Wait, and the Indonesian islands are now... the Dutch East Indies?? These Europeans have one taste of nutmeg and they go conquering foreign lands for it, they never learn...

data.title: America
data.html: What a grotesque downfall. All it took was a few Europeans and their nasty germs to wipe out some of the greatest empires the world has ever seen. And now what is this? Nearly every European nation wants a piece of the Americas, and the Spanish got most of it! And in traditional Spanish fashion, they establish a strict racial code and an economic system that favors the rich whites... how tragic. Oh, and there's a few American colonies now, but it's still the Wild Wild East out there.

data.title: Africa
data.html: Luckily, Africa is safe... for now. Regional mini-empires are sprouting all over the continent, indicating progress!

data.title: Overview
data.html: It's 1783! The world's borders are slowly but surely resembling those of today, but there's still a long way to go... let's take a look around!

data.title: Europe
data.html: Again, nation-states in Western Europe are strengthening their territorial claims in Europe and around the world. Much of Europe is still somewhat stable, aside from the ex-Holy Roman Empire, which looks like a second grade scrapbook on the map right now. Russia has grown into somewhat the Russia we know today, and the Ottomans are holding onto Anatolia strongly.

data.title: Middle East
data.html: While the Ottomans are still holding firmly to their territory, the rest of the Middle East is still shifting, this time we see the resurgence of an Iranian/Persian state, as well as Afghanistan.

data.title: Asia
data.html: European influence in Asia is increasing, with trade monopolies in certain cities like Goa and Madras, and we see the beginnings of British control over India, since India is still comprised of decentralized politically. China is still under the rule of the Qing dynasty.

data.title: America
data.html: In a few centuries, Europeans have taken full control of South and Central America, exploiting its colonies for resources (thanks mercantilism!). Oh, look! It's the baby United States! Just having gained independence by throwing tea into a harbor or something, our wood-toothed hero George Washington has created the glorious nation that will start to terrorize the rest of the world in the next couple of centuries... whoops!

data.title: Africa
data.html: Even more African empires are growing in central Africa, but keep an eye on Dutch and Portuguese settlements in South Africa, it's an indicator of what's to come.

data.title: Overview
data.html: Woah, the world changed a lot... we skipping a few hundred years here and there is not going to be feasible now that the world is changing so fast! Anyways, here's 1920!

data.title: Europe
data.html: A LOT has happened in Europe. The serfs were freed (not really) in Russia, a bunch of monarchies are starting to be challenged internally (see: the French Revolution), and Industrialization! Industrialization and the harsh nationalist climate in the region led to the First World War (shh! don't tell them it's called that, they're gonna freak out). It all started over Austrians being mad at Serbians for killing their prince, and before you know it, Russia, Germany, France, and the US have all intervened... we all need to learn from Switzerland! Oh, and Russia is now the Soviet Union, thanks to Lenin.

data.title: Middle East
data.html: The Ottoman Empire was weakening throughout the 1800s, partially due to a poor approach to industrialization, and it finally became Turkey as we know it today post-WWI. The Middle East and the Arabian Peninsula have developed into nations much like they appear today, but European intervention and occupation of the region are starting to cause anti-Western sentiment.

data.title: Asia
data.html: China has been though a lot. From the Opium Wars, to Spheres of Influence causing the Boxer and Taiping Rebellions, there is a nationalist revolution, abolishing the dynastic system. At this same time, British India is now controlling the entire subcontinent, although I think Gandhi, the INC, and the Muslim League have a few things to say about that.

data.title: America
data.html: Nations in South America are beginning to take shape, with decolonization/independence movements dominating the 1800s. North America has now grown to its present state, and the US, with its intervention in WWI, is now a world power, deeply vested in foreign affairs. First, we better figure out this Great Depression stuff.

data.title: Africa
data.html: Africa is now where South America was last century, with complete European colonialism and imperialist rule, exploiting resources and taking advantage of the native peoples, instigating unnecessary conflicts... all for money and power.
